line_1: Fights uncles, fathers, grandmothers and wives,
line_2: Lays wagers on his own, and others lives,

line_1: But believe me you'll never be wives.
line_2: And put us in fear of our lives,

line_1: Now I have Two right honest Wives,
line_2: For whose Possession No Man strives:

line_1: The Love of Husbands, and the Charms of Wives;
line_2: Then with a Breath along the Air he drives

line_1: Their grushie weans an' faithfu' wives;
line_2: The dearest comfort o' their lives,

line_1: Are tender husbands and obedient wives;
line_2: How those esteem'd of old but tips and chives,

line_1: "Nay," said the Doctor, "dare you trust your wives
line_2: " The joy, the pride, the solace of your lives,

line_1: That Maids make not half such a Tumult, as Wives.
line_2: Learn, Husbands, from hence, for the Peace of your Lives,

line_1: You'd laugh to see the honest wives
line_2: Telling me how their household thrives;

line_1: Our guiltless offspring and our tender wives,
line_2: Content we then must sacrifice our lives,

line_1: Your infant offspring, and your tender wives.
line_2: But heav'n has sent me here, to save your lives,

line_1: Give nought but an oath or a frown to their wives.

line_1: See the tyrant of his wives,
line_2: Prodigal of fairest lives,

line_1: Foresees strange horrors: widows, maids, and wives,
line_2: Young men and old, all anxious for their lives,

line_1: But here they Wed the Sciences for Wives,
line_2: And beat like Hemp at Bridewell for their Lives:

line_1: T' enjoy our bottles and our wives.

line_1: Ye Wretches ingrate! to find Fault with your Wives,
line_2: The Comfort, the Solace, and Joy of your Lives!
